content.description: Poopy bottom with mantle to flat jug hauling to awkward mantle and more 5.6 flat jug hauling. Just go back to Lizard Wall.
content.protection: 5 bolts and carabiner on a single bolt for anchor
content.location: Third route when bolts start showing up for Spider Wall after approach from Lizard wall. The more noticeable route of the first three. Located just before a mid sized roof shows up.

content.description:
This route is the one you came to Spider Wall to climb. Steep prow with good holds, great position, and a crux at the top. This route stays as dry as the prominent part of Lizard Wall. As of March 2018 all the draws were permanent with maybe 5-6 being steel cable draws.

 Consider wearing a helmet as the belayer--the bottom (getting to the high first bolt) is quite alpine. Make sure to knot your rope and pay attention to the climber when lowering off the anchors as the hillside overhangs a fair bit.
content.location: Hike out to Spider wall by heading 5-10 minutes left of Lizard wall along the same trail. Look for the obvious steep Prow with permanent gear.

content.description: Caliban is the main route to do here, although the others deserve more traffic than they get.
